CatDescriptText: Cutline of image published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, May 10, 1958, pg. A24, reads: "For Camp Achievement - In behalf of the Dapper Dan Club, Oscar E. (Sparky) Adams (right), the club's secretary-treasurer, presents a $500 check to Mrs. Alma Illery for Camp Achievement, the 40- acre camping area in Fayette County for white and colored children whose parents cannot afford to send them to summer camps. Observing the presentation are, left, Raymond F. Talbert, of Mellon Bank, vice chairman of the Camp Achievement board of governors, and Aaron P. Levinson, head of Levinson Steel Company, chairman of the camp's board.  Mrs. Illery is founder and president of Camp Achievement. - Harris Photo."
TitMainTitle: Group portrait of Raymond F. Talbert, Alma Illery, Aaron P. Levinson, and Oscar E. "Sparky" Adams, presenting check for Camp Achievement, standing in interior with wool paneled walls
